title: Sri Lanka’s foreign remittances plummets 61.6% in January compared to a year earlier
content: Sri Lanka’s foreign remittances plummets 61.6% in January compared to a year earlier despite 10 rupee incentive per US dollar.“Central Banks stubborn fixed exchange rate at 200 rupees per dollar vs grey market rate of 260 rupees weighs on as more Sri Lankan expatriates chose hawala/undiyal” Senior Financial Journalist Shihar Aneez said.“Sri Lanka’s foreign expatriates are not fools. They switched to hawala 3 months back. CBSL under Ajith Nivard Cabraal came up with strict regulations to stop hawala. But what happened?” he questioned.
